intro: Tithymalus piscatorius, commonly known as the water tithymale, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in wet meadows, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, often appearing in clusters. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
